title: 2025's Top 10 Games, Ranked By How Much Money They Made This Year
description: By     Eddie Makuch   on December 19, 2025 at 6:45AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    Eddie Makuch
   on December 19, 2025 at 6:45AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Top titlesResearch company Newzoo has released its yearly sales report for 2025, and included in the data is a rundown of the top 10 biggest PC and consoles games, ranked by global revenue through the end of November.The report pulls from Newzoo's Game Performance Monitor and tracks digital revenue from six markets: the US, UK, France, Germany, Italy, and Spain. The report covers revenue between January and November 2025.The top PC game by revenue in 2025 was Battlefield 6 and on console it was EA Sports FC 26. Common trends for both lists includes the popularity of shooter games and sports titles."Taken together, the PC and console rankings illustrate a clear split in where value is being created. PC rewards variety, depth, and new IP, while console revenue remains anchored in scale, franchises, and habitual play," Newzoo said.The research company also tracked the top 10 PC and console games ranked by average monthly active users (MAU). Counter-Strike 2 ranked No. 1 on PC, with Fortnite coming out on top for console.Check out the full list of top titles for PC and consoles ranked by revenue below.PC: 10 - Dune: AwakeningPC: 9: Sid Meier's Civilization VIIPC: 8 - Oblivion RemasteredPC: 7 - R.E.P.OPC: 6 - EA Sports FC 26PC: 5 - Borderlands 4PC: 4 - Monster Hunter: WildsPC: 3 - Arc RaidersPC: 2 - Schedule IPC: 1 - BattlefieldConsole: 10 - Borderlands 4Console: 9 - Pokemon Legends: ZAConsole: 8 - Ghost of YoteiConsole: 7 - EA Sports College Football 26Console: 6 - Assassin's Creed ShadowsConsole: 5 - MLB The Show 25Console: 4 - Madden NFL 26Console: 3 -  Battlefield 6Console: 2 - NBA 2K26Console: 1 - EA Sports FC 26

title: There Is No Xbox Wrapped This Year -- Here’s Why It Might Not Be Happening
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          It's almost the end of 2025,...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                It's almost the end of 2025, and in the spirit of Spotify Wrapped, several big companies have invited subscribers to review their last year of activity. Sony got the ball rolling with the PlayStation Wrap-Up, Steam offers a similar annual roundup, and the Nintendo Switch Year in Review recap has been announced for early next year--but where is Xbox in the middle of all this?While it doesn't offer an Xbox wrap-up every year, it still feels odd for Microsoft's gaming brand to skip 2025. The year has seen several high-profile releases from the company and the launch of an Xbox-branded handheld gaming PC alongside Asus, but according to Windows Central, Microsoft is allocating its marketing budget toward celebrating several major anniversaries in 2026.The Xbox brand celebrates its 25th anniversary next year, Blizzard has its 35th anniversary to look forward to, and Bethesda is turning 40. Those are several significant milestones in proximity to each other, and it's a safe bet that Microsoft wants to accommodate them, possibly explaining the lack of an Xbox Wrapped this year. On top of that, we'll see the return of BlizzCon in September, and Blizzard has teased its "biggest year yet" for 2026.Outside of Microsoft, several other gaming franchises will also have plenty of reasons to celebrate. The 30th anniversary of Pokemon is next year, Sonic the Hedgehog turns 35, and both The Legend of Zelda and Castlevania will reach the 40th anniversary milestone in 2026.We have contacted Xbox to find out if there are any plans for a year-in-review wrap-up, and will update this article as soon as we hear back.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Overwatch 2 Studio Says Its "Boldest Ideas" Will Come To Life In 2026
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Overwatch developer Blizzard...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Overwatch developer Blizzard has teased that 2026 will be the year when the studio's "boldest ideas come to life.""We're eager to take creative steps that will allow the game to lean further into storytelling and character development, and we can't wait to share these new experiences with our community," Blizzard said in a blog post. "There's a real sense of momentum and optimism within the development team, and we believe 2026 will be a year where our boldest ideas come to life."Blizzard did not share any further details, but 2026 marks the 10th anniversary of Overwatch, and the studio presumably has some anniversary plans in store for the milestone.Also in the post, Blizzard ran through some reflections of the past year, saying 2025 "brought out the best in the Overwatch team.""Inspired by the evolving landscape of the industry, we embraced the opportunity to take bold risks and focused on making impactful changes rather than playing it safe," the developer said. "The response from our community has been amazing, and we feel our relationship with our players is stronger than ever."Blizzard also called out how Overwatch 2 relaunching in China was a "standout moment" for the game in 2025. "Despite the absence, the community’s passion remained strong, with fans organizing offline events, creating art, and supporting esports. This enduring passion for the Overwatch universe highlighted how the game brings people together and means so much beyond just gameplay, reinforcing our excitement for the future," the developer said.2026 marks the 35th anniversary of Blizzard, and studio president Johanna Faries said it will be the "biggest year yet" for the company. The company is bringing back BlizzCon in September 2026 to share a number of "major" announcements.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
